news_header: Average wages in the UK are rising faster than inflation, with a 3.4% increase from October to December compared to the previous year. The unemployment rate remains at 4.4%, but hiring intentions have weakened, particularly in the hospitality and retail sectors.
news_original_title: UK wages continue to outpace inflation
news_text: Employers are concerned about rising costs due to increased National Insurance and minimum wage hikes, which may impact future pay rises and investment. Annual pay growth, excluding bonuses, was reported at 5.9%, with private sector growth at 6.2% and public sector at 4.7%. The inflation rate stands at 2.5%. A downward trend in pay growth is expected as demand for staff declines and worker availability improves.
